titleStmt.title: R. H. Cormer to Beriah Magoffin
CWG2652

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Civil Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
Owingsville Ky.
Jany 14 1862
To His Excellency B Magoffin

At the Decr Term 1861 of the Bath County Court Wm B Bailey a Justice of the peace for Bath County came into Court and resigned his office, which was accepted by the Court, It was suggested by the retiring Justice, that S. L. Atchison would be a suitable person to succeed him, I concur with him in that opinion, Atchison has been elected Justice of the peace Several times & I think will make a very good one
R. H. Comer Ck. B. C. C.
I concur in the selection of Mr SL Atchison,

Bath
J. P.
S. L. Atchison
No 2.
appd. Jany 18 1862
